ETYMOLOGY: From Middle English 'erering', a compound of 'ear' (from Old English 'eare') and 'ring' (from Old English 'hring').

MEANINGS.POS_TIP: A word (other than a pronoun) used to identify any of a class of people, places, or things (common noun), or to name a particular one of these (proper noun).
MEANINGS.DEF_EN: A piece of jewelry worn on the ear, typically suspended from a pierced hole in the earlobe or clipped onto it.
MEANINGS.DEF_ZH: 戴在耳朵上的饰物，通常通过耳垂上的穿孔或夹在耳垂上。
MEANINGS.SENT_EN: She wore a stunning pair of diamond earrings to the party.
MEANINGS.SENT_ZH: 她戴着一对令人惊艳的钻石耳环去参加派对。
